summary: Gary T. Cornwell was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Cornwell's name, position, and salary for various accounting periods between October 1977 and February 1979. These documents indicate that Cornwell was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. The specific role Cornwell played within the committee is not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll suggests he contributed to the committee's work.
significance: Gary T. Cornwell's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify his exact role, his presence on the payroll indicates his involvement in the committee's operations during its investigation.
